name: Australian Stitch
overview: Australian Stitch is a Melbourne-based clothing maker and retailer producing ethical, small-batch basics. The company operates a Fitzroy retail shopfront and manufactures locally in Thornbury. Its range includes classic cotton tees, heavyweight box tees, hoodies, and jumpers. The business promotes sustainable fashion and supports Australia's local rag trade.
practices: Locally manufactures all apparel in Melbourne using small-batch, ethical production methods
Ensures fair wages, safe working conditions, and equal opportunity employment
Focuses on durable, high-quality basics rather than fast-fashion turnover
Supports regional suppliers including dye houses and fabric producers
Encourages community awareness of sustainable clothing and responsible consumption
sdg_alignment: SDG 8 – Decent Work and Economic Growth

diversity.workplace_equality: Equal opportunity policies are supported internally
diversity.inclusion_policy: Commitment to fair pay and non-discriminatory practices

corporate_governance.description: Privately owned local business with transparent ethical values but no formal public governance disclosures

involvement.Environmental Harm: Low risk due to small-scale local operations
involvement.Supply Chain Transparency: Moderate – publicly states local manufacturing but lacks a formal report

concerns: Would benefit from publishing a sustainability or impact report to improve public transparency
Limited external certifications despite strong local ethical claims
